means: 不顾，不理会，无视( disregard的现在分词 )

sentence.Network_en: I would send them to the capital city, disregarding the transportation expenses.
sentence.Network_cn: 我只得送缴当时的京城, 运费姑且不计.

sentence.Network_en: He concluded by pointing out the dangers of disregarding his advice.
sentence.Network_cn: 发言)结尾他指出了忽视他的忠告的危险性.

sentence.Network_en: Some motorists persist in disregarding the basic rules of the road.
sentence.Network_cn: 一些车手坚持不顾基本交通规则.

PerfectNetExp.abs: Design for Procedural and Applicable Law in Disregarding Corporate Personality公司法人人格否认制度中的程序和法律适用设计
the most violent salvos came from us troops disregarding pakistani sovereignty to fire on taliban fighters sheltering in its tribal belt .最猛烈的一次炮火来自于美军，他们无视巴基斯坦的主权，在部落地带的掩体中向塔利班士兵开火。

list.abs: ...，即被告或者明知错误仍然坚持发表，或者对事件真相“贸然不顾”（reckless disregard）。
...真实仍发表；B、虽非明知不实，但出于不论真实与否的轻率（Reckless Disregard），二者都仍然要负法律责任。
disqualification order 取消资格令disregarded income 计算入息豁免额dissolution 解散
...听者的诠释者当然得“虚己”，用伽达默尔的话说，要“丢弃自己”（disregarding ourselves）。

entry.def: If you disregard something, you ignore it or do not take account of it.

example.ex: He disregarded the advice of his executives...
example.tran: 他对主管层的建议置若罔闻。

example.ex: Critics say he allowed the police and security forces to disregard human rights.
example.tran: 批评人士说他听任警察和安全部队漠视人权。

means.word_mean: 1. in spite of everything; without regard to drawbacks;

sentences.sentence: "he carried on regardless of the difficulties"
